title: Optimize ClassAttributes string building performance
description:
The ClassAttributes.to_class() method clones strings unnecessarily during filtering and collection.

File: src/utils/class_attribute.rs:32-54
Severity: Medium
Type: Performance
Impact: Affects all components on every render

Current implementation uses filter_map with clone and to_string which is inefficient.

Recommended fix: Build string directly without cloning by using as_str() references and push_str().

title: Add validation for Countdown component value range
description:
Countdown component accepts u8 (0-255) but only values 0-99 display correctly with animation.

File: src/components/countdown/component.rs:44
Severity: Low
Type: Usability

The documentation states value must be 0-99 but no validation is performed. Values outside this range will not animate correctly.

Recommended fix options:
1. Clamp value: style=move || format("--value:{};", value.get().min(99))
2. Document that values > 99 display but do not animate
3. Create a newtype wrapper that enforces 0-99 range

title: Implement DataTable component (table-rs inspired)
description:
Create advanced DataTable component inspired by opensass/table-rs with sorting, pagination, search, and loading states.

## Reference
- opensass/table-rs: https://github.com/opensass/table-rs
- Comparison doc: TABLE_COMPARISON.md

## Goals
Provide production-ready data table with features out-of-the-box while maintaining daisyUI theme integration.

## Features (MVP)
1. Column-based data structure (HashMap)
2. Sorting (ascending/descending per column)
3. Pagination with page controls
4. Loading states
5. Empty states
6. daisyUI theme integration
7. Customizable classes and texts

## NOT in MVP
- URL sync (future enhancement)
- Search/filter (future enhancement)
- Custom renderers (future enhancement)

## Implementation
- src/components/data_table/
- Keep existing Table components for flexibility
- New DataTable for smart features

## Success Criteria
- Works with 10,000+ rows efficiently
- Sorting is instant
- Pagination is smooth
- Fully themed with daisyUI
- Simple API for users

## Estimated Effort
2-3 weeks

## Benefits
- Critical missing feature for business apps
- WASM-optimized performance
- Less boilerplate for users
- Competitive with other UI libraries

title: Improve Menu context panic handling
Standardize optional parameter patterns across components
description:
Inconsistent use of #[prop(optional)] vs #[prop(optional, into)] for node_ref parameters.

Severity: Low
Type: Code Quality/Usability

Some components have #[prop(optional)] for node_ref while others have #[prop(optional, into)]. This inconsistency may confuse users.

The 'into' should not be needed for NodeRef parameters since NodeRef is already the target type.

Recommended fix: Audit all components and standardize to #[prop(optional)] for all NodeRef parameters.

title: Remove empty strings from merge_classes calls in Table components
description:
Table components use merge_classes with empty string as first parameter which is unnecessary.

Files affected:
- src/components/table/component.rs:86,112,138,164,190,216

Current code:
class=move || merge_classes("", class)

This is inefficient since there is no base class to merge.

Recommended fix:
Option 1: class=class
Option 2: class=move || class

If no base classes are needed, the merge_classes wrapper is not necessary.

title: Fix Link component default href security issue
description:
The Link component uses href.unwrap_or("#") which creates navigation issues. The # anchor scrolls to top of page when href is None.

File: src/components/link/component.rs:45
Severity: Medium
Type: Security/Usability

Current code:
```rust
href=href.unwrap_or("#")
```

Recommended fix options:
1. Make href required (breaking change)
2. Use javascript:void(0) as default
3. Conditionally render href attribute only when Some

Prefer option 3 for best UX.

title: Add 30 Thaw-UI-inspired components to leptos-daisyui-rs
description:
Expand leptos-daisyui-rs with 30 additional components inspired by Thaw UI library.

## Overview
Add all unique components from Thaw UI (https://github.com/thaw-ui/thaw) that don't exist in daisyUI, maintaining daisyUI theme integration while using Thaw UI as reference for functionality and interactivity.

## Goals
- Implement 30 new components (from 62 to 92 total components)
- Maintain daisyUI theme system integration
- Follow existing library patterns (Signals, NodeRef, spread attributes)
- Use Thaw UI as reference for UX/interactivity
- Style components to work with daisyUI themes

## Component Categories
1. Form & Data Input (10 components)
2. Layout & Structure (6 components)
3. Data Display & Typography (5 components)
4. Navigation (2 components)
5. Feedback & Loading (3 components)
6. Specialized (3 components)
7. System (1 component)

## Reference
- Thaw UI: https://thawui.vercel.app
- Thaw GitHub: https://github.com/thaw-ui/thaw
- Component comparison: THAW_COMPARISON.md
